name: Brie
longDescription: It is pale in color with a slight grayish tinge under a rind of white mould. The rind is typically eaten, with its flavor depending largely upon the ingredients used and its manufacturing environment.
facts: Brie is covered in a white layer.
Brie is one of the world's most popular cheeses.

name: Camembert
shortDescription: A moist, soft, creamy, surface-ripened cow's milk cheese.
longDescription: Camembert is a French cheese with a white, bloomy rind and a soft, slightly runny interior that ripens closest to the rind first.
facts: Camembert was first made in the late 18th century in France.
The amount of ammonia increases as the cheese ripens; after a significant amount of time, the smell can become very strong.

name: Cheddar
longDescription: A relatively hard, off-white (or orange if colourings such as annatto are added), sometimes sharp-tasting, natural cheese.
facts: Coloring was originally added to distinguish where the Cheddar cheese was made.
